Description.val:
The Family of Medium Tactical Vehicles (FMTV) is a complete series of trucks and trailers, based on a common chassis, that vary by payload and mission. The Light Medium Tactical Vehicle (LMTV) has a 2-1/2-ton capacity consisting of cargo and van models. The Medium Tactical Vehicle (MTV) has a 5-ton capacity, consisting of cargo, tractor, van, wrecker, load handling system, and dump truck models. Sub-variants provide Air Drop capability for contingency and rapid deployment operations. Commonality between variants significantly reduces operation and maintenance costs. FMTV performs over 55% of the Army's local, line haul, and unit resupply missions in combat, combat support, and combat service support units. Extended applications of the FMTV include support to other Army requirements such as:  High Mobility Artillery Rocket System (HIMARS); Warfighter Information Network - Tactical (WIN-T); Patriot; Aviation Ground Support Equipment (AGSE); Chemical and Biological Protection Shelter (CBPS); Medium Extended Air Defense System (MEADS); CAMEL II Unit Water Pod System; Terminal High Altitude Area Defense (THAAD); and EQ-36 Fire Finder Radar. FMTV trailers (LMTV & MTV) have the same payload as the LMTV/MTV trucks.

The Approved Acquisition Objective (AAO) is 83,185 trucks: 45,090 MTV trucks, 38,095 LMTV trucks.

Prior year quantities through FY 2010 reflect trucks only. Beginning in FY 2011, quantities reflect trucks and trailers calculated at different unit prices.

Justification.val:
FY 2017 Base Procurement dollars in the amount of $53.293 million supports a full and open contract to be awarded in April 2017 for a quantity of 26 trucks and 5 trailers for First Article Test (FAT) and 8 various Medium Tactical Vehicle Trucks to fill the 5-ton truck requirement, fulfill Army modularity requirements and modernize the medium fleet, reduce operating and support costs, resolve potential operational deficiencies and operate throughout the area of operation as a multi-purpose transportation vehicle used by combat, combat support and combat service support units. PM/Matrix Support includes PM and System Engineering oversight required to manage the program and provide contractor oversight. Salaries, Benefits, Travel, Personnel Training and other government costs are included for retaining a profession acquisition workforce.

FY17 OCO Procurement dollars includes $299.476 million to support the COCOM requirement for unit equipment sets to deter potential adversaries and support the European Reassurance Initiatives.  The procurements includes a quantity of 1,102 various capable trucks in the establishment of six Armored Brigade Combat Team (ABCT) for European Reassurance Initiative (ERI) - Army Preposition Set (APS).  Procurement is necessary to outfit the Pre-Positioned equipment set. There is no excess inventory or viable substitute available to support the ERI requirement.  Army Preposition Set (APS) must be filled with trucks that meet armoring requirements. 

The following SSNs below roll-up to the parent SSN:

LIGHT MEDIUM TACTICAL VEHICLE TRAILER D03500

MEDIUM TACTICAL VEHICLE TRAILER D04500
There are no FY 2017 Base Procurement funding requirements for this program.

LIGHT MEDIUM TACTICAL VEHICLE FAMILY D13500
There are no FY 2017 Base Procurement funding requirements for this program. 

FY17 OCO Procurement dollars in the amount of $40.931 million supports a quantity of 179 various LMTV armor capable trucks to fill the requirement of establishing Armored Brigade Combat Team (ABCT) Army Preposition Set (APS) as part of the European Reassurance Initiative (ERI).   

MEDIUM TACTICAL VEHICLE FAMILY D14500
FY 2017 Base Procurement dollars in the amount of $53.293 million supports a full and open contract to be awarded in April 2017 for  a quantity of 26 trucks and 5 trailers for First Article Test (FAT) and 8 various armor capable MTV trucks to fill the 5-ton truck requirement and modernize the medium fleet, reduce operating costs, resolve potential operational deficiencies and operate throughout the area of operation as a multi-purpose transportation vehicle used by combat, combat support, and combat service support units.

FY17 OCO Procurement dollars in the amount of $258.545 million supports a quantity of 923 various MTV armor capable trucks to fill the requirement of establishing an Armored Brigade Combat Team (ABCT) Army Preposition Set (APS) as part of the European Reassurance Initiative (ERI).

In accordance with Section 1815 of the FY 2008 National Defense Authorization Act (P.L. 110-181), this item is necessary for use by the active and reserve components of the Armed Forces for homeland defense missions, domestic emergency responses, and providing military support to civil authorities.
